com.example.lcn.calc

Class EqtTextWatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.lcn.calc.EqtTextWatcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.text.NoCopySpan, android.text.TextWatcher

    public class EqtTextWatcher
extends java.lang.Object
implements android.text.TextWatcher
    It keeps track of the user's action, transforms the equation accordingly and renders the "relative" equation to deal with the equation text overflow problem. See newText for all possible actions that the user can perform.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface android.text.NoCopySpan

        android.text.NoCopySpan.Concrete

      • onTextChanged

        public void onTextChanged(java.lang.CharSequence newText,
                          int start,
                          int beforeLen,
                          int afterLen)
        executed when the equation is replaced with new text. Note that the first argument newText will be packed as the user's command. See newText for more details.

        This function is responsible for interpreting which command the user tries to perform and transforming the equation accordingly. At last, it will update the window's position.

        Specified by:
        onTextChanged in interface android.text.TextWatcher
        Parameters:
        newText - new equation text
        start - unused
        beforeLen - unused
        afterLen - unused

      • afterTextChanged

        public void afterTextChanged(android.text.Editable newText)
        executed after the equation transformation process is done. This function is responsible for rendering the "relative" equation to the equation display.
        Specified by:
        afterTextChanged in interface android.text.TextWatcher
        Parameters:
        newText - used for replacing with "relative" equation
